responsibilities: Build new and exciting components in an ever-growing and evolving market technology to provide scale and efficiency.
Develop high-quality, production-ready code that can be used by millions of users of our applications.
Make design decisions on the basis of performance, scalability, and future expansion.
Work in a Hybrid Engineering model and contribute to all phases of SDLC including design, implementation, code reviews, automation, and testing of the features.
Build efficient components/algorithms on a microservice multi-tenant SaaS cloud environment.
Code review, mentoring junior engineers, and providing technical guidance to the team (depending on the seniority level).
skills: Proficiency in frontend technologies with 6+ years of experience in full stack web development.
Solid knowledge of web technologies such as JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, XML, Ajax, or TypeScript.
Clear understanding of modular CSS development (BEM, SMACSS).
Broad knowledge of web standards related to APIs, such as REST, SOAP, WSDL, HTTP, JSON, etc.
Experience with front-end frameworks and libraries, including React, Angular, or Vue.js.
Practical knowledge of Web Accessibility best practices, WCAG 2.1 / 2.2 AA compliance, and ARIA.
Strong knowledge of object oriented programming and experience with at least one object oriented programming language (Java, Javascript, C++, C#, Ruby, Python, Node.js).
Experience with version control systems, such as Git, and agile development methodologies.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product management).
Passion for ensuring the customer has an exceptional experience using our products.
Proven experience in designing and implementing large-scale systems with microservices architecture.
Expertise in API design, integration patterns, and RESTful web services.
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and database technologies (SQL/NoSQL).
Strong understanding of LLMs, neural networks, reinforcement learning, and other advanced AI methodologies.
Knowledge of event-driven architectures and messaging systems like Kafka or RabbitMQ.
Familiarity with vector databases, embeddings, and search algorithms is a plus.
Proficiency in DevOps practices, including monitoring, logging, and operational excellence.
Knowledge of AI/ML technologies and their application in enterprise software.
Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI.
Expertise in security best practices, including encryption, identity management, and secure coding.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills provided in the job description align most closely with the role of a Software Engineer (Option 8). The responsibilities include building new components, developing high-quality code, making design decisions, working in a hybrid engineering model, and contributing to all phases of the SDLC, which are typical tasks for a Software Engineer. The skills required, such as proficiency in frontend technologies, knowledge of web technologies, experience with front-end frameworks, and strong object-oriented programming skills, are also consistent with the skills expected of a Software Engineer. Additionally, the job mentions experience with version control systems, agile development methodologies, and CI/CD tools, which are common in software engineering roles. While there are some mentions of AI/ML technologies and advanced AI methodologies, the primary focus of the job seems to be on software development rather than AI research or engineering, making Option 8 the best fit.
